script: AddBarEvent svcmod_hunter_bar_event "Ask around if anyone knows more about the voidlings." "Maybe someone in the local bar might know more about the voidlings?"

text:
While most of the patrons of the bar seem vaguely entertained by your story about encountering angry space crustaceans,
you clearly catch a brief, but distinct, glance from a somber figure in the back.

As you approach, you can make out a haggard face, belonging to a middle-aged man that appears to have made considerable progress on his quest to drown his sorrows in a bottle of schnapps.

"So, 't seems the past has finally caught up to us. Always knew this day'd come eventually, didn't I? Would've much preferred to have kicked the bucket by then..."

The man invites you to sit with a gesture, while letting out a grim chuckle.
options: svcmod_hunter_bar_event3:Encourage the man to continue his story

text:
"Guess there's no harm in telling you the full story, or what I know of it at least. Not like they could do me much worse than they already have..."

"Don't even know who our employer was, or where these creatures came from. Well, not for sure, anyhow. Some thought 't was some heretic trying to profit off of Ludd's punishment for our sins, or some spiritual bullshit. Others were convinced it was a tri-tach bioengineering project. There were rumors about some Sindrian lobster experiments."

"Personally, I think some brain-fried pirate might have stumbled onto something that should've better been left buried somewhere in the outer sector."

The man takes a deep breath and downs another glass of schnapps before continuing his story.

"Whatever the case, 't all went to shit real fast, real good. Heh, who could've guessed that trying to control a swarm of space predators, trying to make them more aggressive, trying to make them hunter fleets, could backfire. Don't get me wrong, we did succeed. Real nice and aggressive, these hunters."

The man shrugs, suddenly appearing a little bit more sober.

"Don't wanna bore you with all the little details. Maybe don't wanna bother myself with 'em. Long story short, most of my team died. The few others that survived seem to have disappeared shortly after. Only reason I'm still kicking's that I chose to disappear myself, first chance I had. Presumed KIA. Not sure I did myself a favor."

The man pauses for a second.

"Controlling voidlings isn't all that hard. Making them hunt fleets sure as hell isn't. But keeping a whole swarm, one with multiple alphas at that, from hunting your fleet, now that, that is impossible. Quickly after, whoever was in charge of this whole thing seemed to be very eager to erase all traces of the project, or at least their involvement, from history."

The man chuckles.

"Guess they hoped the problem of roaming voidlings would just magically disappear. For all I know, even the hunter fleets are still roaming the outer periphery of the sector, looking for big juicy fleets to hunt."

"The equipment we used to try to control them might even still be intact."

The man clears his throat.

"Well, that's about all I know. And now let an old man drink in solitude."

He pours the rest of his schnapps into a shot glass, downs it and gestures towards the bar:
"Order me a new one on your way out, will ya?"
You leave the table, ordering a new bottle of schnapps for the man.

script: AddBarEvent svcmod_hunters_defeated_bar_event "Approach the solemn drinker to talk about the hunter fleets." "You encountered, and defeated, multiple hunter fleets. It might be worth talking to the ex project member again."

text:
"Oh, Captain! Didn’t expect to see you again so soon! Or, well, ever, to be honest. You seemed like the kind of guy that would happily run off to the fringes of the sector to get eaten by one of the hunter swarms."

The man invites you to sit.
options: svcmod_hunters_defeated_bar_event2:Inform the man that you have done exactly that and won

text:
"’That so? Well, I’ll be damned. Guess I owe you some amount of gratitude for cleaning up the mess I left behind. Not that it matters much."

The man remains silent for a moment, thinking.

"Y’know what? I have a feeling I might come to regret this decision, but I haven’t told you the full story before. Right when everything went to shit, I actually snatched a certain device."

"I believe it was meant as some kind of biological weapon but it might as well be used to save a great deal of innocent people. Makes it pretty clear somebody had the power and funding to research how to manipulate those lovely little critters. Guess that pretty much rules out anyone without access to some top-notch research department as the culprit behind this whole operation, huh?"

The man briefly stares at you with a troubled look on his face.

"This thing has been weighing heavily on my conscience for far too long. ‘Been constantly worried it might fall into the wrong hands. Not sure yours are the right ones, but at least it won’t be mine anymore."

The man hands you a small access stick to some kind of private safe deposit locker and sighs, gesturing for you to leave.

"And now let an old man drink in solitude"

options: svcmod_poison_broker_dialogue:A shady figure beckons you to join them in a backroom of the bar.

text: As you look more closely a pair of haphazardly equipped guards can be seen flanking the figure. You spot talismans and Luddic symbols scattered across their gear.

As you enter the dimly lit room one guard locks the door behind you while the other steps closer towards you to pat you down. Pale blue smoke hangs in the air.
The hooded figure sniffs loudly, whipes his nose and mouth on his sleeve, then parts his lips: 
"Word around port is you're looking for something special. Don't ask how I know. What is it you want?"
options:

There's also a mandatory donation to our cause that can be pay... I mean, provided in, let's say 50 units of Heavy Armaments.
Deal?"
